moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. exd5 exd5 4. c4 Nf6: Nxc6 better, developing a knight. But, too late now...
moves.9. Nf3 Bg4 10. Be2 Bxf3 11. Bxf3 c5: ? This loses a rook due to the pin along the h1-a8 diagonal.
moves.12. Bxa8 cxd4 13. O-O: ! Now black has to think smart.
moves.13... Qe5: ??? Caught in the centre. Now he is doomed!
moves.14. Re1: A sweet tactic here. I excitedly move my rook to e1 and exclaim to Kai: “Thanks for the queen. Greatly appreciated.”
moves.23. Qd5+ Ke7 24. Rc7+ Kf6 25. Rf7+ Kg6 2: Checkmate! Hope you enjoyed! Tied for first in the tournament, I played Linus in the final game and won the trophy! These opponents were not hard to beat, but not easy, either. Stick around for some more OTB and regular game annotations.

gameName: OTB 10: OTB tournament game III - my favourite opening against me
